properties.address: Baillieston Care Home, Glasgow, Lanarkshire G69 7XZ
properties.description: You will find Baillieston Care Home located on the outskirts of Glasgow. We are a short distance from local shops, round the corner from the nearest bus stop and stone’s throw away from Glasgow city centre, making us easily accessible for visitors to pop-in for a chat. Our team is committed to enriching the lives of each of our residents. Our team offers nursing care for those who have complex medical needs, as well as nursing dementia care provided by specialist teams trained in the complexities of looking after those living with dementia, who may also have other long-term medical conditions. We also provide respite care to give family or friends a well-earned break. At our homes, residents are deemed part of the Silverline family. We love to enthusiastically encourage residents to take part in all decisions - contributing to everything from the way their room looks, to the activities they par take in. Outside we have a sensory garden, which has found to be most beneficial to our residents. We also accommodate a library for our keen readers at our home. Please do not hesitate to get in touch for further information or update regarding your loved one by using the tab on the right-hand side of this page or please call the home manager on 0141 773 0733.
properties.title: Baillieston Care Home

properties.description: The Cheery Cup is a warm, welcoming drop-in space on Friday mornings, from 10.30 am. We serve tea and coffee with home baking (scones to die for), and provide a space to chat with others and enjoy people's company, to play board games, or simply to find a place of quiet rest. We're also open on Tuesday mornings, from 10.30 am, when folk gather to do crafts and have a blether over tea and coffee.
properties.title: Cheery Cup Drop-In - Millerston United Free Church

properties.description: Derby Libraries will be providing warm spaces with extra seating and free hot drinks to support communities with the cost of living this winter. The spaces will be available to all to relax and connect in a safe, warm, welcoming space. Library staff will be on hand to support people who want to join the library and borrow books as well as sign post people to support and trusted information on the cost of living. There will also be opportunities for people to access a busy regular programme of free activities in the libraries from family rhymetimes to adult book groups. To protect the planet and reduce the use of plastic people are encouraged to bring their own cups into libraries. Everyone is welcome to unlimited refills of tea and coffee. Hot drinks will be available Tuesdays 10am – 1pm
properties.title: Help to Hope Cafe

properties.address: Stobhill Care Home, Glasgow, Lanarkshire G21 3TX
properties.description: Stobhill Care Home with its relaxed and calming atmosphere is situated a brief drive from Glasgow. We are close to the M8 and M80, making us easily accessible for visitors to pop in to have a chat. Our Care team offers nursing care for people who have complex medical needs, as well as 24-hour nursing dementia care provided by expert teams trained in the complexities of looking after those living with dementia, who may also have other long-term medical conditions. We also provide respite care to give family or friends a well-earned break. Our residents enjoy our home's wonderful cinema room where they love to watch their favourite films together. We also have family rooms, which are fantastic places for our residents and their loved ones to spend quality time together. Please do not hesitate to get in touch for further information or update regarding your loved one, please call the home manager on 0141 558 8500.
properties.title: Stobhill Care Home
